   10495             : /**
   10496             :  * xmlXPathCompPrimaryExpr:
   10497             :  * @ctxt:  the XPath Parser context
   10498             :  *
   10499             :  *  [15]   PrimaryExpr ::=   VariableReference
   10500             :  *                | '(' Expr ')'
   10501             :  *                | Literal
   10502             :  *                | Number
   10503             :  *                | FunctionCall
   10504             :  *
   10505             :  * Compile a primary expression.
   10506             :  */
   10507             : static void
   10508           0 : xmlXPathCompPrimaryExpr(xmlXPathParserContextPtr ctxt) {
   10509           0 :     SKIP_BLANKS;
   10510           0 :     if (CUR == '$') xmlXPathCompVariableReference(ctxt);
   10511           0 :     else if (CUR == '(') {
   10512           0 :         NEXT;
   10513           0 :         SKIP_BLANKS;
   10514           0 :         xmlXPathCompileExpr(ctxt, 1);
   10515           0 :         CHECK_ERROR;
   10516           0 :         if (CUR != ')') {
   10517           0 :             XP_ERROR(XPATH_EXPR_ERROR);
   10518             :         }
   10519           0 :         NEXT;
   10520           0 :         SKIP_BLANKS;
   10521           0 :     } else if (IS_ASCII_DIGIT(CUR) || (CUR == '.' && IS_ASCII_DIGIT(NXT(1)))) {
   10522           0 :         xmlXPathCompNumber(ctxt);
   10523           0 :     } else if ((CUR == '\'') || (CUR == '"')) {
   10524           0 :         xmlXPathCompLiteral(ctxt);
   10525             :     } else {
   10526           0 :         xmlXPathCompFunctionCall(ctxt);
   10527             :     }
   10528           0 :     SKIP_BLANKS;
   10529             : }
   10530             : 
   10531             : /**
   10532             :  * xmlXPathCompFilterExpr:
   10533             :  * @ctxt:  the XPath Parser context
   10534             :  *
   10535             :  *  [20]   FilterExpr ::=   PrimaryExpr
   10536             :  *               | FilterExpr Predicate
   10537             :  *
   10538             :  * Compile a filter expression.
   10539             :  * Square brackets are used to filter expressions in the same way that
   10540             :  * they are used in location paths. It is an error if the expression to
   10541             :  * be filtered does not evaluate to a node-set. The context node list
   10542             :  * used for evaluating the expression in square brackets is the node-set
   10543             :  * to be filtered listed in document order.
   10544             :  */
   10545             : 
   10546             : static void
   10547           0 : xmlXPathCompFilterExpr(xmlXPathParserContextPtr ctxt) {
   10548           0 :     xmlXPathCompPrimaryExpr(ctxt);
   10549           0 :     CHECK_ERROR;
   10550           0 :     SKIP_BLANKS;
   10551             : 
   10552           0 :     while (CUR == '[') {
   10553           0 :         xmlXPathCompPredicate(ctxt, 1);
   10554           0 :         SKIP_BLANKS;
   10555             :     }
   10556             : 
   10557             : 
   10558             : }
   10559             : 
   10560             : /**
   10561             :  * xmlXPathScanName:
   10562             :  * @ctxt:  the XPath Parser context
   10563             :  *
   10564             :  * Trickery: parse an XML name but without consuming the input flow
   10565             :  * Needed to avoid insanity in the parser state.
   10566             :  *
   10567             :  * [4] NameChar ::= Letter | Digit | '.' | '-' | '_' | ':' |
   10568             :  *                  CombiningChar | Extender
   10569             :  *
   10570             :  * [5] Name ::= (Letter | '_' | ':') (NameChar)*
   10571             :  *
   10572             :  * [6] Names ::= Name (S Name)*
   10573             :  *
   10574             :  * Returns the Name parsed or NULL
   10575             :  */
   10576             : 
   10577             : static xmlChar *
   10578           0 : xmlXPathScanName(xmlXPathParserContextPtr ctxt) {
   10579           0 :     int len = 0, l;
   10580             :     int c;
   10581             :     const xmlChar *cur;
   10582             :     xmlChar *ret;
   10583             : 
   10584           0 :     cur = ctxt->cur;
   10585             : 
   10586           0 :     c = CUR_CHAR(l);
   10587           0 :     if ((c == ' ') || (c == '>') || (c == '/') || /* accelerators */
   10588           0 :         (!IS_LETTER(c) && (c != '_') &&
   10589           0 :          (c != ':'))) {
   10590             :         return(NULL);
   10591             :     }
   10592             : 
   10593           0 :     while ((c != ' ') && (c != '>') && (c != '/') && /* test bigname.xml */
   10594           0 :            ((IS_LETTER(c)) || (IS_DIGIT(c)) ||
   10595           0 :             (c == '.') || (c == '-') ||
   10596           0 :             (c == '_') || (c == ':') ||
   10597           0 :             (IS_COMBINING(c)) ||
   10598           0 :             (IS_EXTENDER(c)))) {
   10599           0 :         len += l;
   10600           0 :         NEXTL(l);
   10601           0 :         c = CUR_CHAR(l);
   10602             :     }
   10603           0 :     ret = xmlStrndup(cur, ctxt->cur - cur);
   10604           0 :     ctxt->cur = cur;
   10605           0 :     return(ret);
   10606             : }
   10607             : 
   10608             : /**
   10609             :  * xmlXPathCompPathExpr:
   10610             :  * @ctxt:  the XPath Parser context
   10611             :  *
   10612             :  *  [19]   PathExpr ::=   LocationPath
   10613             :  *               | FilterExpr
   10614             :  *               | FilterExpr '/' RelativeLocationPath
   10615             :  *               | FilterExpr '//' RelativeLocationPath
   10616             :  *
   10617             :  * Compile a path expression.
   10618             :  * The / operator and // operators combine an arbitrary expression
   10619             :  * and a relative location path. It is an error if the expression
   10620             :  * does not evaluate to a node-set.
   10621             :  * The / operator does composition in the same way as when / is
   10622             :  * used in a location path. As in location paths, // is short for
   10623             :  * /descendant-or-self::node()/.
   10624             :  */
   10625             : 
   10626             : static void
   10627           0 : xmlXPathCompPathExpr(xmlXPathParserContextPtr ctxt) {
   10628           0 :     int lc = 1;           /* Should we branch to LocationPath ?         */
   10629           0 :     xmlChar *name = NULL; /* we may have to preparse a name to find out */
   10630             : 
   10631           0 :     SKIP_BLANKS;
   10632           0 :     if ((CUR == '$') || (CUR == '(') ||
   10633           0 :         (IS_ASCII_DIGIT(CUR)) ||
   10634           0 :         (CUR == '\'') || (CUR == '"') ||
   10635           0 :         (CUR == '.' && IS_ASCII_DIGIT(NXT(1)))) {
   10636             :         lc = 0;
   10637           0 :     } else if (CUR == '*') {
   10638             :         /* relative or absolute location path */
   10639             :         lc = 1;
   10640           0 :     } else if (CUR == '/') {
   10641             :         /* relative or absolute location path */
   10642             :         lc = 1;
   10643           0 :     } else if (CUR == '@') {
   10644             :         /* relative abbreviated attribute location path */
   10645             :         lc = 1;
   10646           0 :     } else if (CUR == '.') {
   10647             :         /* relative abbreviated attribute location path */
   10648             :         lc = 1;
   10649             :     } else {
   10650             :         /*
   10651             :          * Problem is finding if we have a name here whether it's:
   10652             :          *   - a nodetype
   10653             :          *   - a function call in which case it's followed by '('
   10654             :          *   - an axis in which case it's followed by ':'
   10655             :          *   - a element name
   10656             :          * We do an a priori analysis here rather than having to
   10657             :          * maintain parsed token content through the recursive function
   10658             :          * calls. This looks uglier but makes the code easier to
   10659             :          * read/write/debug.
   10660             :          */
   10661           0 :         SKIP_BLANKS;
   10662           0 :         name = xmlXPathScanName(ctxt);
   10663           0 :         if ((name != NULL) && (xmlStrstr(name, (xmlChar *) "::") != NULL)) {
   10664             : #ifdef DEBUG_STEP
   10665             :             xmlGenericError(xmlGenericErrorContext,
   10666             :                     "PathExpr: Axis\n");
   10667             : #endif
   10668           0 :             lc = 1;
   10669           0 :             xmlFree(name);
   10670           0 :         } else if (name != NULL) {
   10671           0 :             int len =xmlStrlen(name);
   10672             : 
   10673             : 
   10674           0 :             while (NXT(len) != 0) {
   10675           0 :                 if (NXT(len) == '/') {
   10676             :                     /* element name */
   10677             : #ifdef DEBUG_STEP
   10678             :                     xmlGenericError(xmlGenericErrorContext,
   10679             :                             "PathExpr: AbbrRelLocation\n");
   10680             : #endif
   10681             :                     lc = 1;
   10682             :                     break;
   10683           0 :                 } else if (IS_BLANK_CH(NXT(len))) {
   10684             :                     /* ignore blanks */
   10685             :                     ;
   10686           0 :                 } else if (NXT(len) == ':') {
   10687             : #ifdef DEBUG_STEP
   10688             :                     xmlGenericError(xmlGenericErrorContext,
   10689             :                             "PathExpr: AbbrRelLocation\n");
   10690             : #endif
   10691             :                     lc = 1;
   10692             :                     break;
   10693           0 :                 } else if ((NXT(len) == '(')) {
   10694             :                     /* Note Type or Function */
   10695           0 :                     if (xmlXPathIsNodeType(name)) {
   10696             : #ifdef DEBUG_STEP
   10697             :                         xmlGenericError(xmlGenericErrorContext,
   10698             :                                 "PathExpr: Type search\n");
   10699             : #endif
   10700             :                         lc = 1;
   10701             :                     } else {
   10702             : #ifdef DEBUG_STEP
   10703             :                         xmlGenericError(xmlGenericErrorContext,
   10704             :                                 "PathExpr: function call\n");
   10705             : #endif
   10706           0 :                         lc = 0;
   10707             :                     }
   10708             :                     break;
   10709             :                 } else if ((NXT(len) == '[')) {
   10710             :                     /* element name */
   10711             : #ifdef DEBUG_STEP
   10712             :                     xmlGenericError(xmlGenericErrorContext,
   10713             :                             "PathExpr: AbbrRelLocation\n");
   10714             : #endif
   10715             :                     lc = 1;
   10716             :                     break;
   10717             :                 } else if ((NXT(len) == '<') || (NXT(len) == '>') ||
   10718             :                            (NXT(len) == '=')) {
   10719             :                     lc = 1;
   10720             :                     break;
   10721             :                 } else {
   10722             :                     lc = 1;
   10723             :                     break;
   10724             :                 }
   10725           0 :                 len++;
   10726             :             }
   10727           0 :             if (NXT(len) == 0) {
   10728             : #ifdef DEBUG_STEP
   10729             :                 xmlGenericError(xmlGenericErrorContext,
   10730             :                         "PathExpr: AbbrRelLocation\n");
   10731             : #endif
   10732             :                 /* element name */
   10733           0 :                 lc = 1;
   10734             :             }
   10735           0 :             xmlFree(name);
   10736             :         } else {
   10737             :             /* make sure all cases are covered explicitly */
   10738           0 :             XP_ERROR(XPATH_EXPR_ERROR);
   10739             :         }
   10740             :     }
   10741             : 
   10742           0 :     if (lc) {
   10743           0 :         if (CUR == '/') {
   10744           0 :             PUSH_LEAVE_EXPR(XPATH_OP_ROOT, 0, 0);
   10745             :         } else {
   10746           0 :             PUSH_LEAVE_EXPR(XPATH_OP_NODE, 0, 0);
   10747             :         }
   10748           0 :         xmlXPathCompLocationPath(ctxt);
   10749             :     } else {
   10750           0 :         xmlXPathCompFilterExpr(ctxt);
   10751           0 :         CHECK_ERROR;
   10752           0 :         if ((CUR == '/') && (NXT(1) == '/')) {
   10753           0 :             SKIP(2);
   10754           0 :             SKIP_BLANKS;
   10755             : 
   10756           0 :             PUSH_LONG_EXPR(XPATH_OP_COLLECT, AXIS_DESCENDANT_OR_SELF,
   10757             :                     NODE_TEST_TYPE, NODE_TYPE_NODE, NULL, NULL);
   10758           0 :             PUSH_UNARY_EXPR(XPATH_OP_RESET, ctxt->comp->last, 1, 0);
   10759             : 
   10760           0 :             xmlXPathCompRelativeLocationPath(ctxt);
   10761           0 :         } else if (CUR == '/') {
   10762           0 :             xmlXPathCompRelativeLocationPath(ctxt);
   10763             :         }
   10764             :     }
   10765           0 :     SKIP_BLANKS;
   10766             : }
   10767             : 
   10768             : /**
   10769             :  * xmlXPathCompUnionExpr:
   10770             :  * @ctxt:  the XPath Parser context
   10771             :  *
   10772             :  *  [18]   UnionExpr ::=   PathExpr
   10773             :  *               | UnionExpr '|' PathExpr
   10774             :  *
   10775             :  * Compile an union expression.
   10776             :  */
   10777             : 
   10778             : static void
   10779           0 : xmlXPathCompUnionExpr(xmlXPathParserContextPtr ctxt) {
   10780           0 :     xmlXPathCompPathExpr(ctxt);
   10781           0 :     CHECK_ERROR;
   10782           0 :     SKIP_BLANKS;
   10783           0 :     while (CUR == '|') {
   10784           0 :         int op1 = ctxt->comp->last;
   10785           0 :         PUSH_LEAVE_EXPR(XPATH_OP_NODE, 0, 0);
   10786             : 
   10787           0 :         NEXT;
   10788           0 :         SKIP_BLANKS;
   10789           0 :         xmlXPathCompPathExpr(ctxt);
   10790             : 
   10791           0 :         PUSH_BINARY_EXPR(XPATH_OP_UNION, op1, ctxt->comp->last, 0, 0);
   10792             : 
   10793           0 :         SKIP_BLANKS;
   10794             :     }
   10795             : }
   10796             : 
   10797             : /**
   10798             :  * xmlXPathCompUnaryExpr:
   10799             :  * @ctxt:  the XPath Parser context
   10800             :  *
   10801             :  *  [27]   UnaryExpr ::=   UnionExpr
   10802             :  *                   | '-' UnaryExpr
   10803             :  *
   10804             :  * Compile an unary expression.
   10805             :  */
   10806             : 
   10807             : static void
   10808           0 : xmlXPathCompUnaryExpr(xmlXPathParserContextPtr ctxt) {
   10809           0 :     int minus = 0;
   10810           0 :     int found = 0;
   10811             : 
   10812           0 :     SKIP_BLANKS;
   10813           0 :     while (CUR == '-') {
   10814           0 :         minus = 1 - minus;
   10815           0 :         found = 1;
   10816           0 :         NEXT;
   10817           0 :         SKIP_BLANKS;
   10818             :     }
   10819             : 
   10820           0 :     xmlXPathCompUnionExpr(ctxt);
   10821           0 :     CHECK_ERROR;
   10822           0 :     if (found) {
   10823           0 :         if (minus)
   10824           0 :             PUSH_UNARY_EXPR(XPATH_OP_PLUS, ctxt->comp->last, 2, 0);
   10825             :         else
   10826           0 :             PUSH_UNARY_EXPR(XPATH_OP_PLUS, ctxt->comp->last, 3, 0);
   10827             :     }
   10828             : }
   10829             : 
   10830             : /**
   10831             :  * xmlXPathCompMultiplicativeExpr:
   10832             :  * @ctxt:  the XPath Parser context
   10833             :  *
   10834             :  *  [26]   MultiplicativeExpr ::=   UnaryExpr
   10835             :  *                   | MultiplicativeExpr MultiplyOperator UnaryExpr
   10836             :  *                   | MultiplicativeExpr 'div' UnaryExpr
   10837             :  *                   | MultiplicativeExpr 'mod' UnaryExpr
   10838             :  *  [34]   MultiplyOperator ::=   '*'
   10839             :  *
   10840             :  * Compile an Additive expression.
   10841             :  */
   10842             : 
   10843             : static void
   10844           0 : xmlXPathCompMultiplicativeExpr(xmlXPathParserContextPtr ctxt) {
   10845           0 :     xmlXPathCompUnaryExpr(ctxt);
   10846           0 :     CHECK_ERROR;
   10847           0 :     SKIP_BLANKS;
   10848           0 :     while ((CUR == '*') ||
   10849           0 :            ((CUR == 'd') && (NXT(1) == 'i') && (NXT(2) == 'v')) ||
   10850           0 :            ((CUR == 'm') && (NXT(1) == 'o') && (NXT(2) == 'd'))) {
   10851           0 :         int op = -1;
   10852           0 :         int op1 = ctxt->comp->last;
   10853             : 
   10854           0 :         if (CUR == '*') {
   10855           0 :             op = 0;
   10856           0 :             NEXT;
   10857           0 :         } else if (CUR == 'd') {
   10858           0 :             op = 1;
   10859           0 :             SKIP(3);
   10860           0 :         } else if (CUR == 'm') {
   10861           0 :             op = 2;
   10862           0 :             SKIP(3);
   10863             :         }
   10864           0 :         SKIP_BLANKS;
   10865           0 :         xmlXPathCompUnaryExpr(ctxt);
   10866           0 :         CHECK_ERROR;
   10867           0 :         PUSH_BINARY_EXPR(XPATH_OP_MULT, op1, ctxt->comp->last, op, 0);
   10868           0 :         SKIP_BLANKS;
   10869             :     }
   10870             : }
   10871             : 
   10872             : /**
   10873             :  * xmlXPathCompAdditiveExpr:
   10874             :  * @ctxt:  the XPath Parser context
   10875             :  *
   10876             :  *  [25]   AdditiveExpr ::=   MultiplicativeExpr
   10877             :  *                   | AdditiveExpr '+' MultiplicativeExpr
   10878             :  *                   | AdditiveExpr '-' MultiplicativeExpr
   10879             :  *
   10880             :  * Compile an Additive expression.
   10881             :  */
   10882             : 
   10883             : static void
   10884           0 : xmlXPathCompAdditiveExpr(xmlXPathParserContextPtr ctxt) {
   10885             : 
   10886           0 :     xmlXPathCompMultiplicativeExpr(ctxt);
   10887           0 :     CHECK_ERROR;
   10888           0 :     SKIP_BLANKS;
   10889           0 :     while ((CUR == '+') || (CUR == '-')) {
   10890             :         int plus;
   10891           0 :         int op1 = ctxt->comp->last;
   10892             : 
   10893           0 :         if (CUR == '+') plus = 1;
   10894           0 :         else plus = 0;
   10895           0 :         NEXT;
   10896           0 :         SKIP_BLANKS;
   10897           0 :         xmlXPathCompMultiplicativeExpr(ctxt);
   10898           0 :         CHECK_ERROR;
   10899           0 :         PUSH_BINARY_EXPR(XPATH_OP_PLUS, op1, ctxt->comp->last, plus, 0);
   10900           0 :         SKIP_BLANKS;
   10901             :     }
   10902             : }
   10903             : 
   10904             : /**
   10905             :  * xmlXPathCompRelationalExpr:
   10906             :  * @ctxt:  the XPath Parser context
   10907             :  *
   10908             :  *  [24]   RelationalExpr ::=   AdditiveExpr
   10909             :  *                 | RelationalExpr '<' AdditiveExpr
   10910             :  *                 | RelationalExpr '>' AdditiveExpr
   10911             :  *                 | RelationalExpr '<=' AdditiveExpr
   10912             :  *                 | RelationalExpr '>=' AdditiveExpr
   10913             :  *
   10914             :  *  A <= B > C is allowed ? Answer from James, yes with
   10915             :  *  (AdditiveExpr <= AdditiveExpr) > AdditiveExpr
   10916             :  *  which is basically what got implemented.
   10917             :  *
   10918             :  * Compile a Relational expression, then push the result
   10919             :  * on the stack
   10920             :  */
   10921             : 
   10922             : static void
   10923           0 : xmlXPathCompRelationalExpr(xmlXPathParserContextPtr ctxt) {
   10924           0 :     xmlXPathCompAdditiveExpr(ctxt);
   10925           0 :     CHECK_ERROR;
   10926           0 :     SKIP_BLANKS;
   10927           0 :     while ((CUR == '<') ||
   10928           0 :            (CUR == '>') ||
   10929           0 :            ((CUR == '<') && (NXT(1) == '=')) ||
   10930           0 :            ((CUR == '>') && (NXT(1) == '='))) {
   10931             :         int inf, strict;
   10932           0 :         int op1 = ctxt->comp->last;
   10933             : 
   10934           0 :         if (CUR == '<') inf = 1;
   10935           0 :         else inf = 0;
   10936           0 :         if (NXT(1) == '=') strict = 0;
   10937           0 :         else strict = 1;
   10938           0 :         NEXT;
   10939           0 :         if (!strict) NEXT;
   10940           0 :         SKIP_BLANKS;
   10941           0 :         xmlXPathCompAdditiveExpr(ctxt);
   10942           0 :         CHECK_ERROR;
   10943           0 :         PUSH_BINARY_EXPR(XPATH_OP_CMP, op1, ctxt->comp->last, inf, strict);
   10944           0 :         SKIP_BLANKS;
   10945             :     }
   10946             : }
   10947             : 
   10948             : /**
   10949             :  * xmlXPathCompEqualityExpr:
   10950             :  * @ctxt:  the XPath Parser context
   10951             :  *
   10952             :  *  [23]   EqualityExpr ::=   RelationalExpr
   10953             :  *                 | EqualityExpr '=' RelationalExpr
   10954             :  *                 | EqualityExpr '!=' RelationalExpr
   10955             :  *
   10956             :  *  A != B != C is allowed ? Answer from James, yes with
   10957             :  *  (RelationalExpr = RelationalExpr) = RelationalExpr
   10958             :  *  (RelationalExpr != RelationalExpr) != RelationalExpr
   10959             :  *  which is basically what got implemented.
   10960             :  *
   10961             :  * Compile an Equality expression.
   10962             :  *
   10963             :  */
   10964             : static void
   10965           0 : xmlXPathCompEqualityExpr(xmlXPathParserContextPtr ctxt) {
   10966           0 :     xmlXPathCompRelationalExpr(ctxt);
   10967           0 :     CHECK_ERROR;
   10968           0 :     SKIP_BLANKS;
   10969           0 :     while ((CUR == '=') || ((CUR == '!') && (NXT(1) == '='))) {
   10970             :         int eq;
   10971           0 :         int op1 = ctxt->comp->last;
   10972             : 
   10973           0 :         if (CUR == '=') eq = 1;
   10974           0 :         else eq = 0;
   10975           0 :         NEXT;
   10976           0 :         if (!eq) NEXT;
   10977           0 :         SKIP_BLANKS;
   10978           0 :         xmlXPathCompRelationalExpr(ctxt);
   10979           0 :         CHECK_ERROR;
   10980           0 :         PUSH_BINARY_EXPR(XPATH_OP_EQUAL, op1, ctxt->comp->last, eq, 0);
   10981           0 :         SKIP_BLANKS;
   10982             :     }
   10983             : }
   10984             : 
   10985             : /**
   10986             :  * xmlXPathCompAndExpr:
   10987             :  * @ctxt:  the XPath Parser context
   10988             :  *
   10989             :  *  [22]   AndExpr ::=   EqualityExpr
   10990             :  *                 | AndExpr 'and' EqualityExpr
   10991             :  *
   10992             :  * Compile an AND expression.
   10993             :  *
   10994             :  */
   10995             : static void
   10996           0 : xmlXPathCompAndExpr(xmlXPathParserContextPtr ctxt) {
   10997           0 :     xmlXPathCompEqualityExpr(ctxt);
   10998           0 :     CHECK_ERROR;
   10999           0 :     SKIP_BLANKS;
   11000           0 :     while ((CUR == 'a') && (NXT(1) == 'n') && (NXT(2) == 'd')) {
   11001           0 :         int op1 = ctxt->comp->last;
   11002           0 :         SKIP(3);
   11003           0 :         SKIP_BLANKS;
   11004           0 :         xmlXPathCompEqualityExpr(ctxt);
   11005           0 :         CHECK_ERROR;
   11006           0 :         PUSH_BINARY_EXPR(XPATH_OP_AND, op1, ctxt->comp->last, 0, 0);
   11007           0 :         SKIP_BLANKS;
   11008             :     }
   11009             : }
   11010             : 
   11011             : /**
   11012             :  * xmlXPathCompileExpr:
   11013             :  * @ctxt:  the XPath Parser context
   11014             :  *
   11015             :  *  [14]   Expr ::=   OrExpr
   11016             :  *  [21]   OrExpr ::=   AndExpr
   11017             :  *                 | OrExpr 'or' AndExpr
   11018             :  *
   11019             :  * Parse and compile an expression
   11020             :  */
   11021             : static void
   11022           0 : xmlXPathCompileExpr(xmlXPathParserContextPtr ctxt, int sort) {
   11023           0 :     xmlXPathCompAndExpr(ctxt);
   11024           0 :     CHECK_ERROR;
   11025           0 :     SKIP_BLANKS;
   11026           0 :     while ((CUR == 'o') && (NXT(1) == 'r')) {
   11027           0 :         int op1 = ctxt->comp->last;
   11028           0 :         SKIP(2);
   11029           0 :         SKIP_BLANKS;
   11030           0 :         xmlXPathCompAndExpr(ctxt);
   11031           0 :         CHECK_ERROR;
   11032           0 :         PUSH_BINARY_EXPR(XPATH_OP_OR, op1, ctxt->comp->last, 0, 0);
   11033           0 :         SKIP_BLANKS;
   11034             :     }
   11035           0 :     if ((sort) && (ctxt->comp->steps[ctxt->comp->last].op != XPATH_OP_VALUE)) {
   11036             :         /* more ops could be optimized too */
   11037             :         /*
   11038             :         * This is the main place to eliminate sorting for
   11039             :         * operations which don't require a sorted node-set.
   11040             :         * E.g. count().
   11041             :         */
   11042           0 :         PUSH_UNARY_EXPR(XPATH_OP_SORT, ctxt->comp->last , 0, 0);
   11043             :     }
   11044             : }
   11045             : 
   11046             : /**
   11047             :  * xmlXPathCompPredicate:
   11048             :  * @ctxt:  the XPath Parser context
   11049             :  * @filter:  act as a filter
   11050             :  *
   11051             :  *  [8]   Predicate ::=   '[' PredicateExpr ']'
   11052             :  *  [9]   PredicateExpr ::=   Expr
   11053             :  *
   11054             :  * Compile a predicate expression
   11055             :  */
   11056             : static void
   11057           0 : xmlXPathCompPredicate(xmlXPathParserContextPtr ctxt, int filter) {
   11058           0 :     int op1 = ctxt->comp->last;
   11059             : 
   11060           0 :     SKIP_BLANKS;
   11061           0 :     if (CUR != '[') {
   11062           0 :         XP_ERROR(XPATH_INVALID_PREDICATE_ERROR);
   11063             :     }
   11064           0 :     NEXT;
   11065           0 :     SKIP_BLANKS;
   11066             : 
   11067           0 :     ctxt->comp->last = -1;
   11068             :     /*
   11069             :     * This call to xmlXPathCompileExpr() will deactivate sorting
   11070             :     * of the predicate result.
   11071             :     * TODO: Sorting is still activated for filters, since I'm not
   11072             :     *  sure if needed. Normally sorting should not be needed, since
   11073             :     *  a filter can only diminish the number of items in a sequence,
   11074             :     *  but won't change its order; so if the initial sequence is sorted,
   11075             :     *  subsequent sorting is not needed.
   11076             :     */
   11077           0 :     if (! filter)
   11078           0 :         xmlXPathCompileExpr(ctxt, 0);
   11079             :     else
   11080           0 :         xmlXPathCompileExpr(ctxt, 1);
   11081           0 :     CHECK_ERROR;
   11082             : 
   11083           0 :     if (CUR != ']') {
   11084           0 :         XP_ERROR(XPATH_INVALID_PREDICATE_ERROR);
   11085             :     }
   11086             : 
   11087           0 :     if (filter)
   11088           0 :         PUSH_BINARY_EXPR(XPATH_OP_FILTER, op1, ctxt->comp->last, 0, 0);
   11089             :     else
   11090           0 :         PUSH_BINARY_EXPR(XPATH_OP_PREDICATE, op1, ctxt->comp->last, 0, 0);
   11091             : 
   11092           0 :     NEXT;
   11093           0 :     SKIP_BLANKS;
   11094             : }
   11095             : 
   11096             : /**
   11097             :  * xmlXPathCompNodeTest:

   11133             :         /*
   11134             :          * All elements

   11136           0 :         NEXT;
   11137           0 :         *test = NODE_TEST_ALL;
   11138           0 :         return(NULL);

   11232             : /**
   11233             :  * xmlXPathIsAxisName:
   11234             :  * @name:  a preparsed name token
   11235             :  *
   11236             :  * [6] AxisName ::=   'ancestor'
   11237             :  *                  | 'ancestor-or-self'
   11238             :  *                  | 'attribute'
   11239             :  *                  | 'child'
   11240             :  *                  | 'descendant'
   11241             :  *                  | 'descendant-or-self'
   11242             :  *                  | 'following'
   11243             :  *                  | 'following-sibling'
   11244             :  *                  | 'namespace'
   11245             :  *                  | 'parent'
   11246             :  *                  | 'preceding'
   11247             :  *                  | 'preceding-sibling'
   11248             :  *                  | 'self'
   11249             :  *
   11250             :  * Returns the axis or 0
   11251             :  */
   11252             : static xmlXPathAxisVal
   11253           0 : xmlXPathIsAxisName(const xmlChar *name) {
   11254           0 :     xmlXPathAxisVal ret = (xmlXPathAxisVal) 0;
   11255           0 :     switch (name[0]) {
   11256             :         case 'a':
   11257           0 :             if (xmlStrEqual(name, BAD_CAST "ancestor"))
   11258           0 :                 ret = AXIS_ANCESTOR;
   11259           0 :             if (xmlStrEqual(name, BAD_CAST "ancestor-or-self"))
   11260           0 :                 ret = AXIS_ANCESTOR_OR_SELF;
   11261           0 :             if (xmlStrEqual(name, BAD_CAST "attribute"))
   11262           0 :                 ret = AXIS_ATTRIBUTE;
   11263             :             break;
   11264             :         case 'c':
   11265           0 :             if (xmlStrEqual(name, BAD_CAST "child"))
   11266           0 :                 ret = AXIS_CHILD;
   11267             :             break;
   11268             :         case 'd':
   11269           0 :             if (xmlStrEqual(name, BAD_CAST "descendant"))
   11270           0 :                 ret = AXIS_DESCENDANT;
   11271           0 :             if (xmlStrEqual(name, BAD_CAST "descendant-or-self"))
   11272           0 :                 ret = AXIS_DESCENDANT_OR_SELF;
   11273             :             break;
   11274             :         case 'f':
   11275           0 :             if (xmlStrEqual(name, BAD_CAST "following"))
   11276           0 :                 ret = AXIS_FOLLOWING;
   11277           0 :             if (xmlStrEqual(name, BAD_CAST "following-sibling"))
   11278           0 :                 ret = AXIS_FOLLOWING_SIBLING;
   11279             :             break;
   11280             :         case 'n':
   11281           0 :             if (xmlStrEqual(name, BAD_CAST "namespace"))
   11282           0 :                 ret = AXIS_NAMESPACE;
   11283             :             break;
   11284             :         case 'p':
   11285           0 :             if (xmlStrEqual(name, BAD_CAST "parent"))
   11286           0 :                 ret = AXIS_PARENT;
   11287           0 :             if (xmlStrEqual(name, BAD_CAST "preceding"))
   11288           0 :                 ret = AXIS_PRECEDING;
   11289           0 :             if (xmlStrEqual(name, BAD_CAST "preceding-sibling"))
   11290           0 :                 ret = AXIS_PRECEDING_SIBLING;
   11291             :             break;
   11292             :         case 's':
   11293           0 :             if (xmlStrEqual(name, BAD_CAST "self"))
   11294           0 :                 ret = AXIS_SELF;
   11295             :             break;
   11296             :     }
   11297           0 :     return(ret);
   11298             : }
   11299             : 
   11300             : /**
   11301             :  * xmlXPathCompStep:
   11302             :  * @ctxt:  the XPath Parser context
   11303             :  *
   11304             :  * [4] Step ::=   AxisSpecifier NodeTest Predicate*
   11305             :  *                  | AbbreviatedStep
   11306             :  *
   11307             :  * [12] AbbreviatedStep ::=   '.' | '..'
   11308             :  *
   11309             :  * [5] AxisSpecifier ::= AxisName '::'
   11310             :  *                  | AbbreviatedAxisSpecifier
   11311             :  *
   11312             :  * [13] AbbreviatedAxisSpecifier ::= '@'?
   11313             :  *
   11314             :  * Modified for XPtr range support as:
   11315             :  *
   11316             :  *  [4xptr] Step ::= AxisSpecifier NodeTest Predicate*
   11317             :  *                     | AbbreviatedStep
   11318             :  *                     | 'range-to' '(' Expr ')' Predicate*
   11319             :  *
   11320             :  * Compile one step in a Location Path
   11321             :  * A location step of . is short for self::node(). This is
   11322             :  * particularly useful in conjunction with //. For example, the
   11323             :  * location path .//para is short for
   11324             :  * self::node()/descendant-or-self::node()/child::para
   11325             :  * and so will select all para descendant elements of the context
   11326             :  * node.
   11327             :  * Similarly, a location step of .. is short for parent::node().
   11328             :  * For example, ../title is short for parent::node()/child::title
   11329             :  * and so will select the title children of the parent of the context
   11330             :  * node.
   11331             :  */
   11332             : static void
   11333           0 : xmlXPathCompStep(xmlXPathParserContextPtr ctxt) {
   11334             : #ifdef LIBXML_XPTR_ENABLED
   11335           0 :     int rangeto = 0;
   11336           0 :     int op2 = -1;
   11337             : #endif
   11338             : 
   11339           0 :     SKIP_BLANKS;
   11340           0 :     if ((CUR == '.') && (NXT(1) == '.')) {
   11341           0 :         SKIP(2);
   11342           0 :         SKIP_BLANKS;
   11343           0 :         PUSH_LONG_EXPR(XPATH_OP_COLLECT, AXIS_PARENT,
   11344             :                     NODE_TEST_TYPE, NODE_TYPE_NODE, NULL, NULL);
   11345           0 :     } else if (CUR == '.') {
   11346           0 :         NEXT;
   11347           0 :         SKIP_BLANKS;
   11348             :     } else {
   11349           0 :         xmlChar *name = NULL;
   11350           0 :         const xmlChar *prefix = NULL;
   11351           0 :         xmlXPathTestVal test = (xmlXPathTestVal) 0;
   11352           0 :         xmlXPathAxisVal axis = (xmlXPathAxisVal) 0;
   11353           0 :         xmlXPathTypeVal type = (xmlXPathTypeVal) 0;
   11354             :         int op1;
   11355             : 
   11356             :         /*
   11357             :          * The modification needed for XPointer change to the production
   11358             :          */
   11359             : #ifdef LIBXML_XPTR_ENABLED
   11360           0 :         if (ctxt->xptr) {
   11361           0 :             name = xmlXPathParseNCName(ctxt);
   11362           0 :             if ((name != NULL) && (xmlStrEqual(name, BAD_CAST "range-to"))) {
   11363           0 :                 op2 = ctxt->comp->last;
   11364           0 :                 xmlFree(name);
   11365           0 :                 SKIP_BLANKS;
   11366           0 :                 if (CUR != '(') {
   11367           0 :                     XP_ERROR(XPATH_EXPR_ERROR);
   11368             :                 }
   11369           0 :                 NEXT;
   11370           0 :                 SKIP_BLANKS;
   11371             : 
   11372           0 :                 xmlXPathCompileExpr(ctxt, 1);
   11373             :                 /* PUSH_BINARY_EXPR(XPATH_OP_RANGETO, op2, ctxt->comp->last, 0, 0); */
   11374           0 :                 CHECK_ERROR;
   11375             : 
   11376           0 :                 SKIP_BLANKS;
   11377           0 :                 if (CUR != ')') {
   11378           0 :                     XP_ERROR(XPATH_EXPR_ERROR);
   11379             :                 }
   11380           0 :                 NEXT;
   11381             :                 rangeto = 1;
   11382             :                 goto eval_predicates;
   11383             :             }
   11384             :         }
   11385             : #endif
   11386           0 :         if (CUR == '*') {
   11387             :             axis = AXIS_CHILD;
   11388             :         } else {
   11389           0 :             if (name == NULL)
   11390           0 :                 name = xmlXPathParseNCName(ctxt);
   11391           0 :             if (name != NULL) {
   11392           0 :                 axis = xmlXPathIsAxisName(name);
   11393           0 :                 if (axis != 0) {
   11394           0 :                     SKIP_BLANKS;
   11395           0 :                     if ((CUR == ':') && (NXT(1) == ':')) {
   11396           0 :                         SKIP(2);
   11397           0 :                         xmlFree(name);
   11398           0 :                         name = NULL;
   11399             :                     } else {
   11400             :                         /* an element name can conflict with an axis one :-\ */
   11401             :                         axis = AXIS_CHILD;
   11402             :                     }
   11403             :                 } else {
   11404             :                     axis = AXIS_CHILD;
   11405             :                 }
   11406           0 :             } else if (CUR == '@') {
   11407           0 :                 NEXT;
   11408             :                 axis = AXIS_ATTRIBUTE;
   11409             :             } else {
   11410             :                 axis = AXIS_CHILD;
   11411             :             }
   11412             :         }
   11413             : 
   11414           0 :         if (ctxt->error != XPATH_EXPRESSION_OK) {
   11415           0 :             xmlFree(name);
   11416           0 :             return;
   11417             :         }
   11418             : 
   11419           0 :         name = xmlXPathCompNodeTest(ctxt, &test, &type, &prefix, name);
   11420           0 :         if (test == 0)
   11421             :             return;
   11422             : 
   11423           0 :         if ((prefix != NULL) && (ctxt->context != NULL) &&
   11424           0 :             (ctxt->context->flags & XML_XPATH_CHECKNS)) {

   11476             : /**
   11477             :  * xmlXPathCompRelativeLocationPath:
   11478             :  * @ctxt:  the XPath Parser context
   11479             :  *
   11480             :  *  [3]   RelativeLocationPath ::=   Step
   11481             :  *                     | RelativeLocationPath '/' Step
   11482             :  *                     | AbbreviatedRelativeLocationPath
   11483             :  *  [11]  AbbreviatedRelativeLocationPath ::=   RelativeLocationPath '//' Step
   11484             :  *
   11485             :  * Compile a relative location path.
   11486             :  */
   11487             : static void
   11488           0 : xmlXPathCompRelativeLocationPath
   11489             : (xmlXPathParserContextPtr ctxt) {
   11490           0 :     SKIP_BLANKS;
   11491           0 :     if ((CUR == '/') && (NXT(1) == '/')) {
   11492           0 :         SKIP(2);
   11493           0 :         SKIP_BLANKS;
   11494           0 :         PUSH_LONG_EXPR(XPATH_OP_COLLECT, AXIS_DESCENDANT_OR_SELF,
   11495             :                          NODE_TEST_TYPE, NODE_TYPE_NODE, NULL, NULL);
   11496           0 :     } else if (CUR == '/') {
   11497           0 :             NEXT;
   11498           0 :         SKIP_BLANKS;
   11499             :     }
   11500           0 :     xmlXPathCompStep(ctxt);
   11501           0 :     CHECK_ERROR;
   11502           0 :     SKIP_BLANKS;
   11503           0 :     while (CUR == '/') {
   11504           0 :         if ((CUR == '/') && (NXT(1) == '/')) {
   11505           0 :             SKIP(2);
   11506           0 :             SKIP_BLANKS;
   11507           0 :             PUSH_LONG_EXPR(XPATH_OP_COLLECT, AXIS_DESCENDANT_OR_SELF,
   11508             :                              NODE_TEST_TYPE, NODE_TYPE_NODE, NULL, NULL);
   11509           0 :             xmlXPathCompStep(ctxt);
   11510           0 :         } else if (CUR == '/') {
   11511           0 :             NEXT;
   11512           0 :             SKIP_BLANKS;
   11513           0 :             xmlXPathCompStep(ctxt);
   11514             :         }
   11515           0 :         SKIP_BLANKS;
   11516             :     }
   11517             : }
   11518             : 
   11519             : /**
   11520             :  * xmlXPathCompLocationPath:
   11521             :  * @ctxt:  the XPath Parser context
   11522             :  *
   11523             :  *  [1]   LocationPath ::=   RelativeLocationPath
   11524             :  *                     | AbsoluteLocationPath
   11525             :  *  [2]   AbsoluteLocationPath ::=   '/' RelativeLocationPath?
   11526             :  *                     | AbbreviatedAbsoluteLocationPath
   11527             :  *  [10]   AbbreviatedAbsoluteLocationPath ::=
   11528             :  *                           '//' RelativeLocationPath
   11529             :  *
   11530             :  * Compile a location path
   11531             :  *
   11532             :  * // is short for /descendant-or-self::node()/. For example,
   11533             :  * //para is short for /descendant-or-self::node()/child::para and
   11534             :  * so will select any para element in the document (even a para element
   11535             :  * that is a document element will be selected by //para since the
   11536             :  * document element node is a child of the root node); div//para is
   11537             :  * short for div/descendant-or-self::node()/child::para and so will
   11538             :  * select all para descendants of div children.
   11539             :  */
   11540             : static void
   11541           0 : xmlXPathCompLocationPath(xmlXPathParserContextPtr ctxt) {
   11542           0 :     SKIP_BLANKS;
   11543           0 :     if (CUR != '/') {
   11544           0 :         xmlXPathCompRelativeLocationPath(ctxt);
   11545             :     } else {
   11546           0 :         while (CUR == '/') {
   11547           0 :             if ((CUR == '/') && (NXT(1) == '/')) {
   11548           0 :                 SKIP(2);
   11549           0 :                 SKIP_BLANKS;
   11550           0 :                 PUSH_LONG_EXPR(XPATH_OP_COLLECT, AXIS_DESCENDANT_OR_SELF,
   11551             :                              NODE_TEST_TYPE, NODE_TYPE_NODE, NULL, NULL);
   11552           0 :                 xmlXPathCompRelativeLocationPath(ctxt);
   11553           0 :             } else if (CUR == '/') {
   11554           0 :                 NEXT;
   11555           0 :                 SKIP_BLANKS;
   11556           0 :                 if ((CUR != 0 ) &&
   11557           0 :                     ((IS_ASCII_LETTER(CUR)) || (CUR == '_') || (CUR == '.') ||
   11558           0 :                      (CUR == '@') || (CUR == '*')))
   11559           0 :                     xmlXPathCompRelativeLocationPath(ctxt);
   11560             :             }
   11561           0 :             CHECK_ERROR;
   11562             :         }
   11563             :     }
   11564             : }

   11662             : static int
   11663           0 : xmlXPathCompOpEvalPredicate(xmlXPathParserContextPtr ctxt,
   11664             :                             xmlXPathStepOpPtr op,
   11665             :                             xmlNodeSetPtr set,
   11666             :                             int contextSize,
   11667             :                             int hasNsNodes)
   11668             : {
   11669           0 :     if (op->ch1 != -1) {
   11670           0 :         xmlXPathCompExprPtr comp = ctxt->comp;
   11671             :         /*
   11672             :         * Process inner predicates first.
   11673             :         */
   11674             :         if (comp->steps[op->ch1].op != XPATH_OP_PREDICATE) {
   11675             :             /*
   11676             :             * TODO: raise an internal error.
   11677             :             */
   11678             :         }
   11679           0 :         contextSize = xmlXPathCompOpEvalPredicate(ctxt,
   11680           0 :             &comp->steps[op->ch1], set, contextSize, hasNsNodes);
   11681           0 :         CHECK_ERROR0;
   11682           0 :         if (contextSize <= 0)
   11683             :             return(0);
   11684             :     }
   11685           0 :     if (op->ch2 != -1) {
   11686           0 :         xmlXPathContextPtr xpctxt = ctxt->context;
   11687             :         xmlNodePtr contextNode, oldContextNode;
   11688             :         xmlDocPtr oldContextDoc;
   11689           0 :         int i, res, contextPos = 0, newContextSize;
   11690             :         xmlXPathStepOpPtr exprOp;
   11691           0 :         xmlXPathObjectPtr contextObj = NULL, exprRes = NULL;
   11692             : 
   11693             : #ifdef LIBXML_XPTR_ENABLED
   11694             :         /*
   11695             :         * URGENT TODO: Check the following:
   11696             :         *  We don't expect location sets if evaluating prediates, right?
   11697             :         *  Only filters should expect location sets, right?
   11698             :         */
   11699             : #endif
   11700             :         /*
   11701             :         * SPEC XPath 1.0:
   11702             :         *  "For each node in the node-set to be filtered, the
   11703             :         *  PredicateExpr is evaluated with that node as the
   11704             :         *  context node, with the number of nodes in the
   11705             :         *  node-set as the context size, and with the proximity
   11706             :         *  position of the node in the node-set with respect to
   11707             :         *  the axis as the context position;"
   11708             :         * @oldset is the node-set" to be filtered.
   11709             :         *
   11710             :         * SPEC XPath 1.0:
   11711             :         *  "only predicates change the context position and
   11712             :         *  context size (see [2.4 Predicates])."
   11713             :         * Example:
   11714             :         *   node-set  context pos
   11715             :         *    nA         1
   11716             :         *    nB         2
   11717             :         *    nC         3
   11718             :         *   After applying predicate [position() > 1] :
   11719             :         *   node-set  context pos
   11720             :         *    nB         1
   11721             :         *    nC         2
   11722             :         */
   11723           0 :         oldContextNode = xpctxt->node;
   11724           0 :         oldContextDoc = xpctxt->doc;
   11725             :         /*
   11726             :         * Get the expression of this predicate.
   11727             :         */
   11728           0 :         exprOp = &ctxt->comp->steps[op->ch2];
   11729           0 :         newContextSize = 0;
   11730           0 :         for (i = 0; i < set->nodeNr; i++) {
   11731           0 :             if (set->nodeTab[i] == NULL)
   11732           0 :                 continue;
   11733             : 
   11734           0 :             contextNode = set->nodeTab[i];
   11735           0 :             xpctxt->node = contextNode;
   11736           0 :             xpctxt->contextSize = contextSize;
   11737           0 :             xpctxt->proximityPosition = ++contextPos;
   11738             : 
   11739             :             /*
   11740             :             * Also set the xpath document in case things like
   11741             :             * key() are evaluated in the predicate.
   11742             :             */
   11743           0 :             if ((contextNode->type != XML_NAMESPACE_DECL) &&
   11744           0 :                 (contextNode->doc != NULL))
   11745           0 :                 xpctxt->doc = contextNode->doc;
   11746             :             /*
   11747             :             * Evaluate the predicate expression with 1 context node
   11748             :             * at a time; this node is packaged into a node set; this
   11749             :             * node set is handed over to the evaluation mechanism.
   11750             :             */
   11751           0 :             if (contextObj == NULL)
   11752           0 :                 contextObj = xmlXPathCacheNewNodeSet(xpctxt, contextNode);
   11753             :             else {
   11754           0 :                 if (xmlXPathNodeSetAddUnique(contextObj->nodesetval,
   11755             :                     contextNode) < 0) {
   11756           0 :                     ctxt->error = XPATH_MEMORY_ERROR;
   11757           0 :                     goto evaluation_exit;
   11758             :                 }
   11759             :             }
   11760             : 
   11761           0 :             valuePush(ctxt, contextObj);
   11762             : 
   11763           0 :             res = xmlXPathCompOpEvalToBoolean(ctxt, exprOp, 1);
   11764             : 
   11765           0 :             if ((ctxt->error != XPATH_EXPRESSION_OK) || (res == -1)) {
   11766           0 :                 xmlXPathNodeSetClear(set, hasNsNodes);
   11767           0 :                 newContextSize = 0;
   11768           0 :                 goto evaluation_exit;
   11769             :             }
   11770             : 
   11771           0 :             if (res != 0) {
   11772           0 :                 newContextSize++;
   11773             :             } else {
   11774             :                 /*
   11775             :                 * Remove the entry from the initial node set.
   11776             :                 */
   11777           0 :                 set->nodeTab[i] = NULL;
   11778           0 :                 if (contextNode->type == XML_NAMESPACE_DECL)
   11779           0 :                     xmlXPathNodeSetFreeNs((xmlNsPtr) contextNode);
   11780             :             }
   11781           0 :             if (ctxt->value == contextObj) {
   11782             :                 /*
   11783             :                 * Don't free the temporary XPath object holding the
   11784             :                 * context node, in order to avoid massive recreation
   11785             :                 * inside this loop.
   11786             :                 */
   11787           0 :                 valuePop(ctxt);
   11788           0 :                 xmlXPathNodeSetClear(contextObj->nodesetval, hasNsNodes);
   11789             :             } else {
   11790             :                 /*
   11791             :                 * TODO: The object was lost in the evaluation machinery.
   11792             :                 *  Can this happen? Maybe in internal-error cases.
   11793             :                 */
   11794             :                 contextObj = NULL;
   11795             :             }
   11796             :         }
   11797             : 
   11798           0 :         if (contextObj != NULL) {
   11799           0 :             if (ctxt->value == contextObj)
   11800           0 :                 valuePop(ctxt);
   11801           0 :             xmlXPathReleaseObject(xpctxt, contextObj);
   11802             :         }
   11803             : evaluation_exit:
   11804             :         if (exprRes != NULL)
   11805             :             xmlXPathReleaseObject(ctxt->context, exprRes);
   11806             :         /*
   11807             :         * Reset/invalidate the context.
   11808             :         */
   11809           0 :         xpctxt->node = oldContextNode;
   11810           0 :         xpctxt->doc = oldContextDoc;
   11811           0 :         xpctxt->contextSize = -1;
   11812           0 :         xpctxt->proximityPosition = -1;
   11813           0 :         return(newContextSize);
   11814             :     }
   11815             :     return(contextSize);
   11816             : }
   11817             : 
   11818             : static int
   11819           0 : xmlXPathCompOpEvalPositionalPredicate(xmlXPathParserContextPtr ctxt,
   11820             :                                       xmlXPathStepOpPtr op,
   11821             :                                       xmlNodeSetPtr set,
   11822             :                                       int contextSize,
   11823             :                                       int minPos,
   11824             :                                       int maxPos,
   11825             :                                       int hasNsNodes)
   11826             : {
   11827           0 :     if (op->ch1 != -1) {
   11828           0 :         xmlXPathCompExprPtr comp = ctxt->comp;
   11829           0 :         if (comp->steps[op->ch1].op != XPATH_OP_PREDICATE) {
   11830             :             /*
   11831             :             * TODO: raise an internal error.
   11832             :             */
   11833             :         }
   11834           0 :         contextSize = xmlXPathCompOpEvalPredicate(ctxt,
   11835           0 :             &comp->steps[op->ch1], set, contextSize, hasNsNodes);
   11836           0 :         CHECK_ERROR0;
   11837           0 :         if (contextSize <= 0)
   11838             :             return(0);
   11839             :     }
   11840             :     /*
   11841             :     * Check if the node set contains a sufficient number of nodes for
   11842             :     * the requested range.
   11843             :     */
   11844           0 :     if (contextSize < minPos) {
   11845           0 :         xmlXPathNodeSetClear(set, hasNsNodes);
   11846           0 :         return(0);
   11847             :     }
   11848           0 :     if (op->ch2 == -1) {
   11849             :         /*
   11850             :         * TODO: Can this ever happen?
   11851             :         */
   11852             :         return (contextSize);
   11853             :     } else {
   11854             :         xmlDocPtr oldContextDoc;
   11855           0 :         int i, pos = 0, newContextSize = 0, contextPos = 0, res;
   11856             :         xmlXPathStepOpPtr exprOp;
   11857           0 :         xmlXPathObjectPtr contextObj = NULL, exprRes = NULL;
   11858           0 :         xmlNodePtr oldContextNode, contextNode = NULL;
   11859           0 :         xmlXPathContextPtr xpctxt = ctxt->context;
   11860             :         int frame;
   11861             : 
   11862             : #ifdef LIBXML_XPTR_ENABLED
   11863             :             /*
   11864             :             * URGENT TODO: Check the following:
   11865             :             *  We don't expect location sets if evaluating prediates, right?
   11866             :             *  Only filters should expect location sets, right?
   11867             :         */
   11868             : #endif /* LIBXML_XPTR_ENABLED */
   11869             : 
   11870             :         /*
   11871             :         * Save old context.
   11872             :         */
   11873           0 :         oldContextNode = xpctxt->node;
   11874           0 :         oldContextDoc = xpctxt->doc;
   11875             :         /*
   11876             :         * Get the expression of this predicate.
   11877             :         */
   11878           0 :         exprOp = &ctxt->comp->steps[op->ch2];
   11879           0 :         for (i = 0; i < set->nodeNr; i++) {
   11880             :             xmlXPathObjectPtr tmp;
   11881             : 
   11882           0 :             if (set->nodeTab[i] == NULL)
   11883           0 :                 continue;
   11884             : 
   11885           0 :             contextNode = set->nodeTab[i];
   11886           0 :             xpctxt->node = contextNode;
   11887           0 :             xpctxt->contextSize = contextSize;
   11888           0 :             xpctxt->proximityPosition = ++contextPos;
   11889             : 
   11890             :             /*
   11891             :             * Initialize the new set.
   11892             :             * Also set the xpath document in case things like
   11893             :             * key() evaluation are attempted on the predicate
   11894             :             */
   11895           0 :             if ((contextNode->type != XML_NAMESPACE_DECL) &&
   11896           0 :                 (contextNode->doc != NULL))
   11897           0 :                 xpctxt->doc = contextNode->doc;
   11898             :             /*
   11899             :             * Evaluate the predicate expression with 1 context node
   11900             :             * at a time; this node is packaged into a node set; this
   11901             :             * node set is handed over to the evaluation mechanism.
   11902             :             */
   11903           0 :             if (contextObj == NULL)
   11904           0 :                 contextObj = xmlXPathCacheNewNodeSet(xpctxt, contextNode);
   11905             :             else {
   11906           0 :                 if (xmlXPathNodeSetAddUnique(contextObj->nodesetval,
   11907             :                     contextNode) < 0) {
   11908           0 :                     ctxt->error = XPATH_MEMORY_ERROR;
   11909           0 :                     goto evaluation_exit;
   11910             :                 }
   11911             :             }
   11912             : 
   11913           0 :             frame = xmlXPathSetFrame(ctxt);
   11914           0 :             valuePush(ctxt, contextObj);
   11915           0 :             res = xmlXPathCompOpEvalToBoolean(ctxt, exprOp, 1);
   11916           0 :             tmp = valuePop(ctxt);
   11917           0 :             xmlXPathPopFrame(ctxt, frame);
   11918             : 
   11919           0 :             if ((ctxt->error != XPATH_EXPRESSION_OK) || (res == -1)) {
   11920           0 :                 while (tmp != contextObj) {

   11922             :                      * Free up the result
   11923             :                      * then pop off contextObj, which will be freed later
   11924             :                      */
   11925           0 :                     xmlXPathReleaseObject(xpctxt, tmp);
   11926           0 :                     tmp = valuePop(ctxt);
   11927             :                 }
   11928             :                 goto evaluation_error;
   11929             :             }
   11930             :             /* push the result back onto the stack */
   11931           0 :             valuePush(ctxt, tmp);
   11932             : 
   11933           0 :             if (res)
   11934           0 :                 pos++;
   11935             : 
   11936           0 :             if (res && (pos >= minPos) && (pos <= maxPos)) {
   11937             :                 /*
   11938             :                 * Fits in the requested range.
   11939             :                 */
   11940           0 :                 newContextSize++;
   11941           0 :                 if (minPos == maxPos) {
   11942             :                     /*
   11943             :                     * Only 1 node was requested.
   11944             :                     */
   11945           0 :                     if (contextNode->type == XML_NAMESPACE_DECL) {
   11946             :                         /*
   11947             :                         * As always: take care of those nasty

   11959             :                     * We are done.

   11994             : evaluation_error:

   11996           0 :         newContextSize = 0;

   11998             : evaluation_exit:

   12002           0 :             xmlXPathReleaseObject(xpctxt, contextObj);

   12005             :             xmlXPathReleaseObject(ctxt->context, exprRes);

   12007             :         * Reset/invalidate the context.

   12018             : static int
   12019           0 : xmlXPathIsPositionalPredicate(xmlXPathParserContextPtr ctxt,
   12020             :                             xmlXPathStepOpPtr op,
   12021             :                             int *maxPos)
   12022             : {
   12023             : 
   12024             :     xmlXPathStepOpPtr exprOp;
   12025             : 
   12026             :     /*
   12027             :     * BIG NOTE: This is not intended for XPATH_OP_FILTER yet!
   12028             :     */
   12029             : 
   12030             :     /*
   12031             :     * If not -1, then ch1 will point to:
   12032             :     * 1) For predicates (XPATH_OP_PREDICATE):
   12033             :     *    - an inner predicate operator
   12034             :     * 2) For filters (XPATH_OP_FILTER):
   12035             :     *    - an inner filter operater OR
   12036             :     *    - an expression selecting the node set.
   12037             :     *      E.g. "key('a', 'b')" or "(//foo | //bar)".
   12038             :     */
   12039           0 :     if ((op->op != XPATH_OP_PREDICATE) && (op->op != XPATH_OP_FILTER))
   12040             :         return(0);
   12041             : 
   12042           0 :     if (op->ch2 != -1) {
   12043           0 :         exprOp = &ctxt->comp->steps[op->ch2];
   12044             :     } else
   12045             :         return(0);
   12046             : 
   12047           0 :     if ((exprOp != NULL) &&
   12048           0 :         (exprOp->op == XPATH_OP_VALUE) &&
   12049           0 :         (exprOp->value4 != NULL) &&
   12050           0 :         (((xmlXPathObjectPtr) exprOp->value4)->type == XPATH_NUMBER))
   12051             :     {
   12052             :         /*
   12053             :         * We have a "[n]" predicate here.
   12054             :         * TODO: Unfortunately this simplistic test here is not
   12055             :         * able to detect a position() predicate in compound
   12056             :         * expressions like "[@attr = 'a" and position() = 1],
   12057             :         * and even not the usage of position() in
   12058             :         * "[position() = 1]"; thus - obviously - a position-range,
   12059             :         * like it "[position() < 5]", is also not detected.
   12060             :         * Maybe we could rewrite the AST to ease the optimization.
   12061             :         */

   12064           0 :         if (((xmlXPathObjectPtr) exprOp->value4)->floatval ==
   12065           0 :             (float) *maxPos)
   12066             :         {
   12067             :             return(1);
   12068             :         }
   12069             :     }
   12070             :     return(0);
   12071             : }

   12073             : static int
   12074           0 : xmlXPathNodeCollectAndTest(xmlXPathParserContextPtr ctxt,

   12079             : 
   12080             : #define XP_TEST_HIT \

   12257             :     * the  short-hand form, i.e., "[n]".
   12258             :     *
   12259             :     * Example - expression "/foo[parent::bar][1]":
   12260             :     *
   12261             :     * COLLECT 'child' 'name' 'node' foo    -- op (we are here)
   12262             :     *   ROOT                               -- op->ch1
   12263             :     *   PREDICATE                          -- op->ch2 (predOp)
   12264             :     *     PREDICATE                          -- predOp->ch1 = [parent::bar]
   12265             :     *       SORT
   12266             :     *         COLLECT  'parent' 'name' 'node' bar
   12267             :     *           NODE
   12268             :     *     ELEM Object is a number : 1        -- predOp->ch2 = [1]
   12269             :     *

   12303             :      *  - For the namespace axis, the principal node type is namespace.
   12304             :      *  - For other axes, the principal node type is element.
   12305             :      *

   12968             :         default:
   12969           0 :             return (xmlXPathCompOpEval(ctxt, op));
   12970             :     }
   12971             : }

   13272             : /**
   13273             :  * xmlXPathCompOpEval:
   13274             :  * @ctxt:  the XPath parser context with the compiled expression
   13275             :  * @op:  an XPath compiled operation
   13276             :  *
   13277             :  * Evaluate the Precompiled XPath operation
   13278             :  * Returns the number of nodes traversed
   13279             :  */

   13281           0 : xmlXPathCompOpEval(xmlXPathParserContextPtr ctxt, xmlXPathStepOpPtr op)

   13283           0 :     int total = 0;
   13284             :     int equal, ret;

   13292           0 :     CHECK_ERROR0;

   13295             :         case XPATH_OP_END:
   13296             :             return (0);

   13298           0 :             bakd = ctxt->context->doc;

   13303           0 :             CHECK_ERROR0;
   13304           0 :             xmlXPathBooleanFunction(ctxt, 1);

   13404           0 :                 xmlXPathValueFlipSign(ctxt);

   13406           0 :                 CAST_TO_NUMBER;
   13407           0 :                 CHECK_TYPE0(XPATH_NUMBER);
   13408             :             }
   13409           0 :             return (total);
   13410             :         case XPATH_OP_MULT:

   13413           0 :             pp = ctxt->context->proximityPosition;
   13414           0 :             cs = ctxt->context->contextSize;

   13419           0 :             ctxt->context->proximityPosition = pp;
   13420           0 :             ctxt->context->contextSize = cs;
   13421           0 :             total += xmlXPathCompOpEval(ctxt, &comp->steps[op->ch2]);

   13424           0 :                 xmlXPathMultValues(ctxt);

   13426           0 :                 xmlXPathDivValues(ctxt);
   13427           0 :             else if (op->value == 2)
   13428           0 :                 xmlXPathModValues(ctxt);
   13429           0 :             return (total);
   13430             :         case XPATH_OP_UNION:
   13431           0 :             bakd = ctxt->context->doc;
   13432           0 :             bak = ctxt->context->node;
   13433           0 :             pp = ctxt->context->proximityPosition;
   13434           0 :             cs = ctxt->context->contextSize;

   13873           0 :                     newset = xmlXPathNodeSetCreate(NULL);
   13874             :                     /*
   13875             :                     * SPEC XPath 1.0:
   13876             :                     *  "For each node in the node-set to be filtered, the
   13877             :                     *  PredicateExpr is evaluated with that node as the
   13878             :                     *  context node, with the number of nodes in the
   13879             :                     *  node-set as the context size, and with the proximity
   13880             :                     *  position of the node in the node-set with respect to
   13881             :                     *  the axis as the context position;"
   13882             :                     * @oldset is the node-set" to be filtered.
   13883             :                     *
   13884             :                     * SPEC XPath 1.0:
   13885             :                     *  "only predicates change the context position and
   13886             :                     *  context size (see [2.4 Predicates])."
   13887             :                     * Example:
   13888             :                     *   node-set  context pos
   13889             :                     *    nA         1
   13890             :                     *    nB         2
   13891             :                     *    nC         3
   13892             :                     *   After applying predicate [position() > 1] :
   13893             :                     *   node-set  context pos
   13894             :                     *    nB         1
   13895             :                     *    nC         2
   13896             :                     *
   13897             :                     * removed the first node in the node-set, then

   13899             :                     */

   14168             : /**
   14169             :  * xmlXPathCompOpEvalToBoolean:

   14257             : #ifdef XPATH_STREAMING

   14431           0 :                 depth++;

   14574             : /**
   14575             :  * xmlXPathEvalPredicate:
   14576             :  * @ctxt:  the XPath context
   14577             :  * @res:  the Predicate Expression evaluation result
   14578             :  *
   14579             :  * Evaluate a predicate result for the current node.
   14580             :  * A PredicateExpr is evaluated by evaluating the Expr and converting
   14581             :  * the result to a boolean. If the result is a number, the result will
   14582             :  * be converted to true if the number is equal to the position of the
   14583             :  * context node in the context node list (as returned by the position
   14584             :  * function) and will be converted to false otherwise; if the result
   14585             :  * is not a number, then the result will be converted as if by a call
   14586             :  * to the boolean function.
   14587             :  *
   14588             :  * Returns 1 if predicate is true, 0 otherwise
   14589             :  */
   14590             : int
   14591           0 : xmlXPathEvalPredicate(xmlXPathContextPtr ctxt, xmlXPathObjectPtr res) {
   14592           0 :     if ((ctxt == NULL) || (res == NULL)) return(0);

   14594             :         case XPATH_BOOLEAN:
   14595           0 :             return(res->boolval);
   14596             :         case XPATH_NUMBER:
   14597           0 :             return(res->floatval == ctxt->proximityPosition);
   14598             :         case XPATH_NODESET:
   14599             :         case XPATH_XSLT_TREE:
   14600           0 :             if (res->nodesetval == NULL)
   14601             :                 return(0);

   14604           0 :             return((res->stringval != NULL) &&
   14605           0 :                    (xmlStrlen(res->stringval) != 0));
   14606             :         default:
   14607           0 :             STRANGE
   14608             :     }
   14609           0 :     return(0);

   14673             : static xmlXPathCompExprPtr
   14674           0 : xmlXPathTryStreamCompile(xmlXPathContextPtr ctxt, const xmlChar *str) {
   14675             :     /*
   14676             :      * Optimization: use streaming patterns when the XPath expression can
   14677             :      * be compiled to a stream lookup
   14678             :      */
   14679             :     xmlPatternPtr stream;
   14680             :     xmlXPathCompExprPtr comp;
   14681           0 :     xmlDictPtr dict = NULL;

   14686           0 :     if ((!xmlStrchr(str, '[')) && (!xmlStrchr(str, '(')) &&
   14687           0 :         (!xmlStrchr(str, '@'))) {
   14688             :         const xmlChar *tmp;
   14689             : 
   14690             :         /*
   14691             :          * We don't try to handle expressions using the verbose axis
   14692             :          * specifiers ("::"), just the simplied form at this point.
   14693             :          * Additionally, if there is no list of namespaces available and
   14694             :          *  there's a ":" in the expression, indicating a prefixed QName,
   14695             :          *  then we won't try to compile either. xmlPatterncompile() needs
   14696             :          *  to have a list of namespaces at compilation time in order to
   14697             :          *  compile prefixed name tests.
   14698             :          */
   14699           0 :         tmp = xmlStrchr(str, ':');
   14700           0 :         if ((tmp != NULL) &&
   14701           0 :             ((ctxt == NULL) || (ctxt->nsNr == 0) || (tmp[1] == ':')))
   14702             :             return(NULL);
   14703             : 
   14704           0 :         if (ctxt != NULL) {
   14705           0 :             dict = ctxt->dict;

   14707           0 :                 namespaces = xmlMalloc(2 * (ctxt->nsNr + 1) * sizeof(xmlChar*));
   14708           0 :                 if (namespaces == NULL) {
   14709           0 :                     xmlXPathErrMemory(ctxt, "allocating namespaces array\n");
   14710           0 :                     return(NULL);
   14711             :                 }
   14712           0 :                 for (i = 0, j = 0; (j < ctxt->nsNr); j++) {
   14713           0 :                     ns = ctxt->namespaces[j];
   14714           0 :                     namespaces[i++] = ns->href;
   14715           0 :                     namespaces[i++] = ns->prefix;
   14716             :                 }
   14717           0 :                 namespaces[i++] = NULL;
   14718           0 :                 namespaces[i] = NULL;
   14719             :             }
   14720             :         }
   14721             : 
   14722           0 :         stream = xmlPatterncompile(str, dict, XML_PATTERN_XPATH,
   14723             :                         &namespaces[0]);
   14724           0 :         if (namespaces != NULL) {
   14725           0 :             xmlFree((xmlChar **)namespaces);
   14726             :         }
   14727           0 :         if ((stream != NULL) && (xmlPatternStreamable(stream) == 1)) {
   14728           0 :             comp = xmlXPathNewCompExpr();
   14729           0 :             if (comp == NULL) {
   14730           0 :                 xmlXPathErrMemory(ctxt, "allocating streamable expression\n");

   14746           0 : xmlXPathOptimizeExpression(xmlXPathCompExprPtr comp, xmlXPathStepOpPtr op)

   14748             :     /*
   14749             :     * Try to rewrite "descendant-or-self::node()/foo" to an optimized
   14750             :     * internal representation.
   14751             :     */

   14754           0 :         (op->ch1 != -1) &&
   14755           0 :         (op->ch2 == -1 /* no predicate */))
   14756             :     {
   14757           0 :         xmlXPathStepOpPtr prevop = &comp->steps[op->ch1];

   14761           0 :                 AXIS_DESCENDANT_OR_SELF) &&

   14793             :                     break;

   14885             : /**

   14890             :  * @toBool: 1 if only a boolean result is requested
   14891             :  *
